title: 'Why isn't he a sir?' Phillip Schofield demands knighthood for doctor who performed pioneering life-saving surgery on baby
text:

Phillip Schofield was left demanding Dr Stephen Wesataby get a knighthood, after he revealed how he saved the life of Kirsty - who had six ‘silent’ heart attacks by the time she was six months old. 
Speaking on This Morning with Kirsty, now 18, and her mum Becky, heart surgeon Stephen told Holly Willoughby and Philip of how he cut a third of Becky’s heart out in pioneering surgery. 
He said: “I went out to tell Becky her baby had died, but I couldn’t face the grief of her parents - that’s the part of the job I detest. 
“So I turned around and chopped a third of her heart off to make it smaller. Read More Phillip Schofield demanded the guest get a knighthood (Photo: ITV) Heart surgeon Stephen Westaby performed pioneering surgery (Photo: ITV) Kirsty owes her life to the surgeon (Photo: ITV) 
“It’s the laws of geometrics - I made it a better shape.” 
Amazingly, he saved his tiny patient's life - and Becky and Kirsty revealed how grateful they are for that. 
Becky said: “If it wasn’t for him, she wouldn’t be here.” 
Today, Kirsty is an 18-year-old, athletic student. She has been able to attend school, go to prom and spend time with her friends. Read More Becky confessed how grateful she is to him (Photo: ITV) Phillip and Holly were so impressed (Photo: ITV) Holly couldn't get over it (Photo: ITV) 
And Phillip and Holly both couldn’t understand why Dr Stephen has been honoured by the Queen for his incredible work. 
Phillip questioned: “Why isn’t he a Sir?” 
And a stunned Holly agreed: “He pulled this thing out of his pocket that you put into a heart, but we didn’t have time to show it!”
